content: One of the better novels published by Hosted Games. I would recommend reading this.
Great one of the best I've ever played
TRASH
This is one of the best titles of Hosted Games. Good story, good characters, good conflict, and good presentation of choices!
One of the best of the choice of games entries. Choices generally don't end up having disasterous results so it is more enjoyable

The story is okay, but quite limiting. At the end, your choices only matter with regards to how long the story would be and you are stuck with the same edning anyway. The only alternative is to manage to "kill yourself" early by making the wrong choice, but you have to do this on purpose, as the plot is too linear. All in all, this is a mediocre story to read and, unfortunately, not worth the money.
Different but enjoyable.
One Of The Best CoG to DATE.

Great game! I had a lot of fun and was surprised where the end took me. The world building was a bit basic and could have used some extra work to not feel boilerplate. Still very enjoyable, would recommend.
I liked the story and how well written it is. Love it.
Enjoyable, relatable, and a great deal of replay ability and lots of achievements. I highly recommend this game. The storytelling was top shelf. ♡♡♡

I've been reading these interactive novels for a while now, this one was a very good read. Very rarely do I come across one of these novels written as well and as smoothly as this is. The ending I came across just left me very satisfied too. I loved this read and I'll recommend it to anybody!

It was a very well done game that you just dont want it to end. Loved how you are able to switch sides if you wanted to get both sides of the story from working for the government or the resistance with spectacular twists and turns. Romancing could of been more in depth but it's a game of action and the romancing was still satisfying. Main reason for only 4 stars is that it felt a tad rushed at times but overall a fun story which I hope a sequel is on its way.
Excellent story, well written

Another great CYOA story from Hosted games, I love the diversity of the choices that you can make and how different the plot turns out depending on your choices. The game has great replayability because of all of the achievements and various ends that you can have. The character developments and setting are well written and make you feel immersed in the author's world and the role you are presented with. I greatly enjoy this story and look forward to more interesting titles in the future. Thanks
Brilliant. I love this story. The depth and complexity displayed is impecable. I'd love to see a sequel, or just more from this author.
excellent game

Perfect. I always loved stories like this. And no matter how many 
playthroughs, I still look forward to the story. Finch is perfect, by the 
way. More games like this! Kudos to the author.

I was doubtful about this game as I'm not a steampunk aficionado, but the reviews convinced me to give it a try. I'm so glad I did. This is one of the best text based RPGs I've ever played. Constantly unpredictable, well-written, twisty, interesting, and super fun. I also appreciated the historical references. How can I argue with being the brilliant man to trace a cholera epidemic to the Broad Street water pump?
The story and cyoa aspects are amazing. I deducted a star because you need to sign up by email to get save points.
good game... i hope for a sequel.
An absolute masterpiece. Ive had it on my phone for years, and still play it usually once a year. Definitely top 3 COG all time. my personal favorite.

As a fan of Sherlock Holmes I couldn't have helped but love the story! I did like the fact that you cannot create the 'back up' of every step - you have to face the consequences of your choices which makes you more attentive and leaves you with the satisfaction you authored really good piece of storytelling!
A great steampunk story. A little tech, a little of the supernatural. Excellent player agency, unlike some games in this vein. Great replayability too.
Its good yet through the Ripper gameplay I see options right before the Finch encounter that I can not choose for some reason. Please fix it.
The game had a great storyline. The ending I got brought a tear to my eye

Of all the Choice of Games and Hosted Games I've played, this blew them all out of the water in terms of how satisfying it was. The characters are great, the romances are nicely detailed, the plot is well structured and time is spent on the things that really needed it. Choices feel like they truly matter, and the most important part of all: The author anticipated reader reactions such that whenever I wanted to act a certain way, the option would almost always be there. Great immersive experience.
Tak tohle jsem si opravdu užil. Výborné volby, výborná atmosféra, dobrá psychologie postav. Jen ty skoky v příběhu by mohly být menší.
Good story, very well written.
Oh Heck Yeah
Great story. I've read many of these and this is one of the best if not the very best.

Gripping, thrilling and overall engrossing. I love the story and the many differences seemingly innocent choices can make. Edit: I finished my story in this and can't bring myself to go again for one reason. I don't want to change my story. It was more than satisfying. It was my personal perfect story in steampunk. Whatever ending you get as long as it's your story and every choice made was your own then you'll love it. Like the best steampunk novel ever written. And I'll hold my story in my heart for as ling as I remember it.

I've played hundreds of these games over the years, both my Hosted Games and Choice Of Games llc (as well as a few others). And I can confidently say that this is by far one of the best of the genre I have ever played. The story is compelling, the world is immersive, the characters are interesting, but most of all the choices are meaningful. The game is also very well written, wirh suoerb descriptions that really do set the scenr extremely well. I personally played the game in a short number of long sittings, as it was far too compelling to put down. However subsequent playthroughs have been in smaller chunks, and is a marvellous way to pass time. This is a game that definitely lends itself to multiple playthroughs, and I would highly recommend to anyone. Regardless of whether or not you have any experience in this particular genre of games. It's worth every penny, and I have already recommended the game to everyone I know. Well done!

The only flaw in this game is the inability to pick your gender, besides 
that glaring flaw, which kept me from buying it for over a year, it truly 
is one of the best, most engrossing narratives under the hosted games 
banner.

One of the best interactive fiction stories! You get very invested in the 
characters. The author does a good job fairly representing the perspective 
of each choice. He/she doesn't seem 5o push you in any one direction.

Evocative, intriguing and richly detailed. Highly replayable, and the 
characters are wonderfully well-written. Fantastic work.
Itsa perty guud

I started but quit upon lack of gender option for me. Maybe good story but 
that froze it
One of the best i ever played

Great game. Even if there is only one gender to play, you can immerse 
yourself into the main character's story. Overall, the game exceeded my 
expectations and it was a great adventure to be part of.
Great story
Wonderful storytelling and characters. It flowed really well.. Perfect escapism!

Great story and game. Like any good 'choices' game there are multiple paths to follow, and the one you choose will ultimately be down to your own personal morality.  Speaking of which, I loved how you were allowed to form your own opinions on situations instead of being told how your character is feeling. I recommend buying this game. It's a good length, broken up into manageable chapters, with opportunities to save.
Didn't want it to end
The 2nd best Hosted Game I've played yet. Well worth the price.

It might not have the almost-infinite replayability of the Sea of Infinity series, (Sabres, Guns,) but I still found myself playing it over and over, just because the story itself enticed me so much. The dashing heroics of the first and last part, combined with the comfy middle, meant I came back for more dozens of times.
Amazing plot and world.

Flawed Storytelling I keep running into scenarios where I learn something about the story and have no idea how that happened. How did I meet this healer dude? When and why am I not able to practice medicine? It's like I missed huge chunks of the story and no idea what choices I made could have led to the current state of the story. One chapter I'm teaching medicine, the next I'm not allowed to, and no explaination on why.
This Is the best game ever made by hosted game

It may not be a big deal to others, but not being able to choose your gender really hurt this game for me. Yes, considering the time period it makes sense, however this is a work of fiction - meaning it can be whatever you want it to be. These games are about choices, so being able to choose who your character is is kind of important. The story was well written and, truly, I feel like I could have enjoyed it were it not for the fact that I couldn't play as a character that represented me. Just a thought for the author.

I don't review games very often, but this game was absolutely stunning. The writing flows beautifully and the characters really tug on the heartstrings. My only criticism is that the main character must be a male. I would of adored the option to play as your gender of choice. However, a quick change of name and you may trick yourself into thinking you're playing the gender of your choice. Because of this I was a little hesitant to purchase, but I'm certainty​ glad I did.

Playing through this was amazing! I was truly impressed by all the different paths you could take, and how it would change your relationships with certain characters. This is a smart, wonderful, sharp, heartfelt game. It's a pretty long game for a Choicescript game, but I still wish there was more simply because it is so delightful. Highly recommended.
This story offered an extensive and extremely captivating experience that will stick with me as one of the best choice books out there!

Best game I have played in this genre. The writing is really good, and all the scenes seem to serve a purpose. The choices are meaningful and take you where you want. This is really excellent work. Thank you!

While steampunk doesn't look nearly as glorious in text I still enjoyed the game immensely. Would have liked to choose my gender though. The game could get pretty stressful decision-wise but some people like that kind of thing. Still, this was one of the Choice Of games that left me with a satisfying ending.
Excellent game, and surprisingly involving.  Plenty of tough decisions to make which have a direct effect on the outcome of the story.  Good  length too. Certainly recommend this
Decent

Brilliant story. The different chapters are small stories of their own, they don't seem to infpuence one another. I'm probably going to play another time and make drastically different choices to check out if they really matter.
Amazing story and I'm only in part 3 love how the game really captures you. A must buy even for this price.

In my opinion this game is alright but not as good "The Great Tournament" from the same developer.  I just didn't care much for the characters. I found most of them were boring stereotypes. TGT was a bit like that too but at least it had humour. This game takes itself way too seriously. There is also hardly any backstory, you barely know about your character apart from he was in a war and his granny was a healer.  My choices did appear to be more impactful than in TGT though and changed the story considerably. It also annoyed me that after I told Finch I wasn't interested, the exact same sequence happened again making me reject him again.  I think having same sex options is good (I wish TGT had them), but I don't want to be sexually harassed. Overall for me while Study in Steampunk is technically impressive it' s also forgettable.
Couldn't stop playing/reading!

It's purely brilliant. Solid writing, long story, detailed background, meaningful choices, believable characters, much action -- great work. Enjoyed every minute of reading it from the beginning to the end, and plan to start again because of very extensive branches. This is a masterpiece of "choose your own adventure" genre that is worth every penny. I highly recommend it.

Great story.... great writing.....really a pleasure to play.....wish it were a bit longer...but I really enjoyed it..... Loved the twists and turns.....I plan on playing a few more times and see what happens....
Compelling story and characters, extremely interesting to play as a character with PTSD that actually manifests during gameplay. Thoroughly enjoyable.

This is no doubt the most in depth choice of games project. The steam punk features of society mixed  with conflicts of religion, attacks on religion by the law force, political decisions that can be influenced by smooth talking, multiple relationships that are friendly and deeper, the very sudden tense moments that actually make a decisions count, with above 6 hrs of gameplay for my 1st play through I am happy to give this game a 5, and I'm definitely going to play through it again.
Bloodydamn!  Worth every penny, buy it as soon as you can! The only gripe I'd have is not enough choice in some aspects, but the author is only human. Best Choice of Games yet. Sequel, stat!
Really gets you invested, like really, and lots of choices, many hard

One of the best, if not the best, CoG game I've played! I absolutely loved it. My only issue is that there is no way to restart the game once you've started it. However, the quality of the game itself makes up for this issue.
I play a lot of these story games- and I'm not sure why this one felt flat to me- but it did. It was boring for the most part. But that's just my experience.
A marvelous written novel, where you can choose the important actions... Best experience ever!
Great game.  I love the different mysteries, adventures and cases to solve.  The characters and their interactions are compelling and spot on.  I enjoyed reading/playing and re-reading/re-playing.
Immensely replayable and satisfyingly diverse. I would love to play more adventures in this world.

Great story. I usually don't like when you can't pick your own gender, but playing an innovative Watson role made up for it. I almost never review games, but this was great. I've read the sherlock cannon, and it was true in spirit with a unique twist. I look forward to reading it again and picking other options
A bit confusing. It's well put together and has a good story and a well made morally grey area, but a bit to long for my taste.
Awesome game. Fully worth the price.
Best story of any chose your own adventure game I've seen, and I played a bunch. Try it! You'll love it. There is actual emotional connection with characters and plot
I am a huge sherlock fan, but the steampunk mix kind of killed it for me. The story seem to slow and un-engaging for me.

This is the best game I've played in a very long time, the decisions were hard and the choices were many. I made bad mistakes along with the good. Did what was right (and what some might consider wrong) but they all felt like this decision might be my downfall. Whether to be stealthy or go in guns blazing were both enticing and required thought based on the situation. I finished my first playthrough and might have many more

I loved the many ways the story could end, and the multiple different branches one could take. With success also dependent on the character stats, it really opens up the opportunity for engaging, mulltiple playthroughs! Totally worth the purchase.

This has absolutely and undoubtedly been the most amazing CYOA game I have ever had the pleasure of reading. 10/10. Will and do recommend to any and everyone. The story was so immersing, well written, and lengthy that I completely forgot I wasn't reading an acclaimed novella.   I know how much I hesitate when trying to decide whether or not to spend money on any of Hosted or Choice Of's games because the writing quality can vary so drastically, but please purchase this! You won't regret it, and the creator deserves as much support as we can manage! A wonderful piece of work!
One of the best CYOA games out. Definitely worth the money hope the sequel comes out soon!
Good quality of writing, loads of choices. Conflicts might be not too subtle, but the flow is totally enjoyable.
The BEST choice of games game yet...by FAR. Offers an immersive branching storyline where your choices ACTUALLY MATTER. Even if you are not interested in the steampunk genre it is still AMAZING.
A really fun game with lots of great choices and replay value. My only problem is that my achievements keep disappearing. I get nearly all of them and then it resets itself to zero.
I keep coming back to this. I love it, I need more.
Great game
One of the best Choose Your Own Adventure stories I've read, the choices you make have depth and meaning.

Perfect blend of Victorian sci-fi, Sherlock Holmes meets H.G.Wells. The story direction I have chosen has a bit of the Bruce Partington Plans woven into it. It's got the Post Apocalyptic feel to it as well. I need to get further into it but I can tell this is worth every shilling.
Your choices do matter and all of the outcomes are well thought out. If you like choose your own adventure this is a must buy.
This game is a damn masterpiece. Loved it. And it sure wort every cent
One of the best.
An in-depth and interesting cast. Well-paced and satisfyingly long storytelling. Up to par with Tin Star.
By far the best choice of game I've played, worth every penny and then some.
This game is just mwah mwah I need more!
I bought this game on a whim. I'm glad I did that. Amazing characters, engrossing plotlines, truly a one of kind. I'm giving this a 5/5 as I replay and get as many endings as I can.
Greatly engrossing  to read and make decisions. Just wish it had more graphics.

This game is just so good! I seriously recommend it to everyone!  As an example of just how GOOD this is, this is the ONE Choice of Game/Hosted Game that I have NEVER deleted from my phone. Ever. All the other ones get boring once you know the story already and there's very little replay value for them after five playthroughs, BUT THIS ONE...gosh, I think I must have something like fourteen playthroughs since it first came out!  It's really the subtlety of this one that rewards the readers, unless you choose precisely the same choices every single time, there really are subtle differences in how characters react to you in every playthrough making each one a relatively unique experience. And that's not even pointing out the fact that it's technically five adventures with one long overarching one that gives it extra longevity.  But what really makea this game special to me are the characters. They're so well-written, and gosh the writing is just so good because even in my first playthrough I felt like I had really known them all for years by the end of it.  I highly, highly recommended this game to anyone who loves steampunk, Sherlock Holmes, mysteries, adventures, or even just plain reading. There's probably never going to be a better Choice of/Hosted Games.

When I first started the game and kept seeing "sir" and "lad" being used to describe my character, I restarted and did numerous double takes to make sure I just didn't miss a gender choice. Sadly, the game has you gender-locked. I'm transfeminine, so I had to do quite a bit of mental gymnastics in order to actually feel connected to and see myself as my character without making myself feel unneedingly uncomfortable, which in the end, half-ruined a perfectly good and immersive story.

A Steampunk Sherlock Holmes,  Moriarty and Irene Adler included, with you as a mesh of Holmes and Watson, and a little magic thrown in. I'm only one playthrough in, so may revise, but the replay value seems truly immense and the various paths actually viable which sadly is often not the case in CYOA'S

Amazing story, plots, paths and characters. Chose the wrong person to be with in the end, and feel hollow and crappy for it (come back to me...) Fell a bit short when I realised my stats didn't really help with my choices though?
I was so absorbed I didn't want it to end.

I don't understand what went wrong here. This story is so highly rated, from an author with other good stories and published by a pretty solid company. But the story falls so flat so hard. It miss uses and ignores it's great theme, the chapters are all so isolated and don't interact. No chose your own adventure does good romance, but this is VERY hand fisted. And the imagery dose not set scenes well. Go get Mecha Ace, it's much better, cheaper and better uses a sort of simaler theme.
I loved every second of it. The story is fantastic, has great characters, plot, and variety. Above all though, it felt like my choices mattered. I highly recommend it to anyone and everyone.

The storyline was captivating, it was long and fulfilling. It was very easy to keep up with your stats, and you can playthrough more than once. I really hope for a part two, I would most definitely be buying. I wish I could rate this 1000 stars.
TOTALLY AMAZING!! I recommend it, it's worth the price!

~Love it!  Not one of the so typical shoot 'em up games, one mostly finds available.  This was something different and creative.  It allowed me creativity... I had to think about how I wanted MY character to react to the given situation.  Very nice usage of Victorian, Sherlock Holmes & Dr. Watson, Steampunk background.  A good way to relax and truly escape into the story.   I highly recommend this game / book.

Dark, brooding, dripping with enough atmosphere that you can smell the oil and smoke; this is a textbook example of how to make a CoG. The choices are numerous and change the entire plot structure, characters are as layered, intriguing and menacing as the plot is intelligent, dramatic and technically superb. A Study in Steampunk is a spectacular read from start to end, and a must buy for anyone looking for a good, serious read that grips you for every page. This stands among the top of the Hosted library.

I've read almost all of Co's games (though most of them, only once), and this is by far the best of them all. It is compelling and original, while also managing to be Sherlock Holmes-esque(duh, right?)

I just finished my first run of the game. Often I had to pause and consider my options, often two choices seemed to fit and twice I had to set my phone down and ask myself "What kinda of man is Lenard J. Murry? What does he want from this?". The story is engaging and I felt like my choices mattered. I highly recommend this game. Now excuse me, but I'm going to take another run, and maybe this time I can save more lives. Or maybe, in this life, I'll take them instead... .
Probably some sort of copyright violation, but a great game nonetheless!  Can't wait to see what's next
Amazing. Just all around superb. I'm in love with this game, everyone who had a hand in making this did a wonderful job. Thank you for giving the world this beautiful work. :)

This combines the best elements of storytelling, interactivity with compelling characters with and in-depth, immersive setting.  The choices completely affect the storyline and provide high emotional impact for the protagonist.  By far my favorite from the choice of games publisher and I will be looking forward to the authors future works. Hoping for a sequel.
An unexpectedly deep and imaginative storyline
Lots of twists, great story, well written. And at least if the decisions had no affect on the story it changed your stats. Worth paying for, it's enough of an improvement over the free ones.
Steampunk Sherlock Holmes. What's not to love?
My story ended badly, but I was too immersed in the story to even care. You're hooked before you even realize it.

Sympathetic, believable characters. An intriguing, interesting plot. A rich, engrossing world and lore. Consequential choices that actually matter. Though, you may not be able to pick your gender, it does not feel constricting. The game is comfortably long with well-written interludes. All three romanceable characters are wonderful in their own way. All in all, it is one of the few games of choices, I would willingly recommend (And trust me I have played a lot of them).

userName: Sky not the one that does minecraft
content: I play a numerous amount of choice games, and I was very happy with this one. The amount of varying storylines and choices that all intertwine was amazing, and it showed the amount of work and time devoted to this novel. The only choice game to make me play fully through 4 times

Have yo ever wanted to see Sherlock in a steampunk meets magic mashup, play as an alternate John  watson and choose to be straight bi or gay, deal with moral issues and intriguing plots, if so this game is for you.

It's so worth it. I really mean it and I've played a lot of 'Choice of Games' and it one of my favourites. The characters are awesome, the story is too and there is so much re-play value. Not many text-base games can say that.

In general, I don't like reading. However, I couldn't help finding myself becoming lost in the interesting plot, believable characters and the realistic decisions that I had to choose from. Completely lost track of time while playing this. Amazing
I lived the choices and writing throughout, and highly recommend this to anyone.
Really enjoyable book. Great Characters. Must read.
Speechless
Amazing Story w/ Drastic Choices

Basically, I cried, Thrilled, Awed, Laughed, and doing so while having a huge fangasm because this interactive novel has some simmilarities to that of a sherlock's. Trully, an amazing piece of literature.

I'm reading it for the 7th time now and I try to get a different route every time. It's amazing how some desicions you make have such a huge i fluence on the story. And even after reading so often it never gets boring because there are so many choices and different ways. Just amazing work. And the characters are so well made it's awesome.

Sympathetic characters, believable relationships and an utterly engrossing story, all set in a completely fascinating world. It made me laugh and cry and giggle, it made my mouth drop open. In some games, the player character is a boring one-dimensional cutout; this game is the perfect opposite of that. It is so vivid and real. This is without a doubt the best story that Hosted and Choice of Games have to offer!
Great writing, I loved every minute of this game, will be replaying it again right away.
No choice of gender. What interests me in choice games is how I have control over the things pertaining the main character, and choosing gender falls into it.
I loved the story, the mystery, the thrill. Every dicision I made makes me want to play again
This has been a very interesting read for me. I found myself waking up and falling asleep playing through this. I would recommend this to anyone interested in any type of choice of games.

I have played alot of these games. This Is by far the best  and my favorite. It's huge. It has so many differences per play through and character build and you get the same key story points but from different perspectives. Great writing and story and characters and twists. Epic story.
Choice takes you places

I have played almost all of the Choice games and this one is at the top of my list. Wonderful characters, indepth story, tons of choices for story paths. Just really, really good. Leaves me wishing for more.

Seriously, I spent hours on this story, and I'm still hungry for more. I tend to stay away from stories that don't let me play as a girl or gender neutral but I loved this despite that. The story is so emersive and the choices felt like they mattered. I would love to buy more from this author

Pretty solid narrative, even if some ways the story goes seem a bit forced. But that was probably to make it easier to write about 9 chapters full of big decisions (Seriously). It was also pretty ingenious at making me feel actual griev. (But probably for another person than most that played it) and that one event even actually changed the way my character saw the world. Never had that before in this kind of game. Very good all in all.
So freakin good!!!!!!!!"
This game has kept me entertained for days, easily one of the best put out

Perhaps I'm weird, or maybe it's that I'm not that into the Steampunk genre, but I didn't didn't this game engaging at all. I mean, the writing is fantastic and the characters seem interesting....but I played it for a bit, got bored and deleted it. Maybe I should try it again sometime and try harder to understand what's going on?
Loved every ending,  romance choices and characters are so vivid. Worth every cent.

Not going to try to put some wordy review.. If you heard of this title and are here.. Just buy it. Trust me. I put this up there with Zombie Exodus, and Hero series. Probably higher than the hero series because this game gives you more room for choice and not set on getting you eventually to one point.
Perfect

I play many of these games, but this one was especially great. It was plenty long, had great characters, and most importantly your choices mattered. And from that, it is one of the few games you can play through repeatedly because of how different the outcomes are depending on what you chose. It is worth the money.
It is one thoroughly enjoyable adventure.

I went into this expecting some pretty big things, considering the reviews and I was not disappointed. This has so much replay value I've played it three times. I sure hope another one like this hits the store soon and hopefully more by the author.

Thoroughly well written and superbly paced. The game strikes a perfect balance between its rock solid narrative and at the same time making sure the choices we get to make always mattered. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a good story, rpg, and anything in between.
Well written and very entertaining.
One of the best CoG and that says something. Love these

Just completed this game & it is now one of my new favorites! It is so very detailed & such a long game that it truly seemed to go on forever... in a good way! The choices that you make while playing the game really do make big differences within the story. Truly an excellent gaming experience!!

Definitely one of the best choice of game I've played. I was engrossed from the beginning. The only thing I regret is the lack of choice for your gender, but that is easy to  look over because the story is so riveting.

I'm the one who have tried to learn an English by playing choice of game, and this work taught me a lot. I love the story, all the characters and all the choices in this game. Everything seems real, even all dilemmas that make me stare at my screen for ten minutes. The language is beautiful and I love a rhythm in the story. This game is one of my favorite now and thanks again to write this great work!!

I have just finished reading this book and I'm blown away by the amount of detail that was in it. The story is very long to begin with,and it's captivating from start to finish.What surprised me the most is that at the middle of the game you get to choose from three different paths,each being unique in its way. And on top of all these from time to time you get to play the detective. Playing the detective has it all in these game,from investigating to interrogating and once I even had to make a moral choice.
Not only was is it well written and is set in a well thought up world, but it combines two of my favorite things: Steampunk and Choice of Games.
I really loved this book. It had depth and complexity to the narrative, and my choices really mattered. This is the greatest Choice book I have played so far. I highly recommend this to everyone.
Complex and engaging story with many paths. I can't wait to play it again :)
10/10 would become emotionally devastated again
enjoyed  the story

Certinly great value good read.For my personal taste was a bit too political some of the more insterting aspects were not as fully realized, I basically played for a more fantasy setting but dont feel rewarded 5th star for length and pontintiol.
I usually fill my reviews with long winded responses about character choice and the effect it has on the game, but all I can say about this is that it's perfect and I can't  wait for the sequel
It's good. Just wished that I could've played as a woman though.
I have finished many interactive novels. A Study in Steampunk is my favourite one so far. Just read it. I don't think you'll regret. ( glad I got a happy ending on my first try, btw ^ - ^)
Great writing and a lot of choice. Long enough to make the next reading different.

A lengthy novel with great replay value. I felt as if my choices and skillset really mattered. I can't wait to play it again to see different endings. The setting was fun, the story had great twists, and there were plenty of tough choices to make.
Well written and very entertaining.  I really enjoyed it.   Looking forward to your next story.

The story was interesting, the writing was solid, overall it was pretty engaging and there's significantly different ways things can go. Despite this, and being the longest CoG story I've seen, I can't help but feel it was incomplete. Things in later chapters feel rushed, and the story ends right where I was expecting it to really take off. So that was disappointing. But if you like CoG, I would definitely recommend it.

This game is pretty amazing in the characters, plot, and your choices! One of the drawbacks is it would have been nice to choose your gender, but I get why you can't. Still an awesome game can't wait for more from this author :)
A significant amount of quality content I expect more great adventures from this author
The story and all the choices you can make is truly amazing
Easily one of the best written games out there.
Absolutely fantastic. I loved the romance I chose so much I grinned ear to ear. The plots are amazing and each choice really matters, especially as time goes on. Please play it.
This game is far above and beyond my expectations. It is enthralling, exciting, intriguing, and really fun. It is well worth the money
Wow so much depth and twists. It is extremely satisfying and fun.

At first I thought it was pricey for a game that didn't include choosing your gender (you're locked into playing a man), but it was really worth it. The story overshadows the price and the locked gender.

I loved this steampunk epic novel so much! I've played many choice of games books and this one ranks up there with Choice Of Robots. And this story IS LONG. You want the most story for your buck? And it's most excellent? Buy this, friend

Engaging story all the way! There are so many ways for it to go, and the game has a lot for you as a player to explore and enjoy. I recommend this game to those who wish for drama, a great deal of tension and choices that feel like they matter. It isn't too long, and it tells its story well with its length and medium. Give it a shot. You won't be disappointed! Warning: Story may involve some sad feels.
A fantastic and well written story. Definitely worth the read.
Different to any other game I've played. Really well constructed. I loved it. Now to play it again with different choices to see where they take me!

Easily the best game in the Choice Of series. Highly recommended. You play a rather interesting version of Watson, a former-military surgeon in a rather immersive world. Using your powers of investigation, you'll enter a world of steam powered monstrosities, magic, and the erstwhile Professor battling you behind the scenes. A highly imaginative bit of intrigue.

The single best choice of games game I have EVER played. I've played about 10 of them, and this one takes the cake. Every decision matters, the storytelling is magnificent, the humor is gut renching, and it is long enough to be well worth the money spent on it. If you are contemplating buying this, contemplate no further. Buy this amazing game, you won't regret it! :^D

This is the first time I have played one if these and it was fascinating. Im usually one for novels but this felt like a really good use of the smartphone platform. The story really does twist around your decisions. I reccomend for anyone who wants something more stimulating than a casual game to do with thier phone time. I ended up using it both like a book (i.e. 20-40 minutes at a time, and also waiting for busses etc.

The story itself is excellent-- well-written and well-paced. An excellent homage to the Sherlock Holmes series as well (I won't speak for the others listed). There's enough similarities in character and plot structure to remind me of Sherlock Holmes, but it's different enough to be played on its own merits. Perhaps more importantly, for an interactive novel, there's plenty of substance in one play through. Plenty of maneuverability too, which makes it worth replaying.
Absolutly my favorite Choice Of game. Elements from Sherlock Holmes stories, with many twists and turns. Just wonderful.
This is amazing in every way, enough said.
This game is definitely worth its price. The story is compelling and the writing is great.
Love it!! 5/5 highly recommend

This is definitely on my list of top 5 CoG games, and I've probably played 25 or 30 of them. I almost never play games in which I'm made to play as a man, either, so that I loved this game immensely really speaks to its quality.

This is the best and the longest interactive novel ever. I don't regret spending almost all my Google money on it. The story is very well written, the characters are interesting and likeable, and the romance feels realistic. The story just keeps me up all night until 3 in the morning. Just like Zombie Exodus, I got addictive to Steampunk.
Really is the best of its kind meaningful choices griping story tons of characters different endings you play the way you want nothing can change the way you want to play

I love the detail.  The length.  And best of all the story.  You can drastically change the entire game with one awnser. I love the story and everything about it.  I'm going to go through again just cause.  Wish there were more like this one.
Amazing
Cannot wait to read more like this

This is the fourth game of its kind that I have played and by far the most satisfying. It's long enough to take several hours, enough choices to make that influence the outcome, plenty of literate writing and dialog that build a strong story. Well worth the price, I think it was  $5, because the main character can create  (with your choices, several significantly different storylines. Truly excellent!    Similar games that I recommend are Attack of the Clockwork Army, Pendragon Rising, and Samurai of Hyuga

Such joy to read and a story where you really feel that your choices matter. It might even be the best cyoa game I have played. I felt like the story was my own, my choices felt natural and streamlined. My name was Dr. Dale Tucker and this game took me on one heck of a ride!
Played numerous times

It was nice to see that the choices actually mattered for a change. This game was worth every penny and filled with content. As a Sherlock Holmes fan , I really enjoyed the character and story references. My compliments to the author. If more interactive fiction games were like this one, the genre wouldn't be so under rated
This game is insanely well thought out, and the replay value of it is definitely worth the small price. I recommend this to anyone who likes text based games, and endorse it fully.
Abso-fu**ing-lutely brilliant. Enjoyed every second of this story.

I was worried that the steampunk aspect would be used as an excuse, a throwaway, a setpiece meant to dolly up an otherwise uninspired story. I'm so happy that I was wrong. A tale where you play as Watson analogue set in a world more closer to real life than many fantastical steampunk stories out there. No airship battles, girls with goggles or high spirited adventure here. Instead, face chlorea epidemics, government incompetance, war and religious persecution. A must play.
Gripping story, great character and immersive writing - it's all there. I've played it several time and I still discover new things. Just wished there was a ton more! :)
One of best choice games I've played loved the Sherlock influence with a twist.
very engaging
I wish there was the option of being a woman.
Absolutely awesome, best "Choice of" I've played. Actions have consequences....being evil is particularly amusing ;) cheers, keep it up!
I thought this game was just really hyped, but its actually one of the best choice games I've ever played, and I've played about all of them, the choices really matter

I can't begin to describe the riveting thrill playing this game was. So well-written, so many choices! The devotion and commitment is obvious. Well worth the buy -- a sweetly long story with incredible plot and gameplay. Thank you, Heather Albano.
Loved it from start to finish!
One of the best I've ever read. Fantastic author and wonderfully written story. Highly recommended.

This is an amazing game that truly immerses you from start to finish. Yes there's no choice on gender but considering the time its understandable. What I liked most about the game is how church vs state, progression vs tradition, people vs government and intrigue on every level is masterfully woven into this story. Bravo to the Author and bravo to CoG for hosting them.
Perfect steampunk game that shows imagination can still produce the best stories.

I wish that I could have found this 2 years ago. Nothing is as fulfilling as this story. They have heart, fellow feeling, dreams realized and unrealized, and the nature of the beast. It hurts to leave.
This game is one of the best cog has produced yet. The story was lengthy and enthralling, I got attached to the characters. It was definitely a pleasure to have been able to read this.
More more more more more more more!

Choose your own adventure stories are a favorite of mine. A Study in steam punk has been one of the best, with branching choices, real and bittersweet results, and even drastically different endings. If you have ever enjoyed text based adventures make sure to grab this one.

Amazing story,  haven't  yet completed my 1st play through,  but will definitely  play a second time and try a different route.  Love it a sequel would be amazing and will definitely  buy if it's as good as this one
Not usually a steampunk fan but enjoyed dishonoured so give it a try and found myself loving it.

With a little bit of Star Wars light and dark sides thrown into this settings religion and It all blends perfectly.  This is a great story with a near perfect length. Believable romances with great plot and character development. I loved it 6*
Great writing style and writer, loved it and would reccomend to any who are skeptical about it to give it a try, and as always never judge a book by it's cover

Best one yet! Many different paths, the replay value is great!I unless I missed something, I kept hoping Pierce would make an appearance given his importance to your characters back story though. But awesome job!
I have been playing these games for a few years now and this one stands among the best for replay ability and engaging characters.  Highly recommended.
An excellent and thrilling adventure

I've only finished what I believe is a third of the major ways to play, with countless others. I've experienced sorrow, fear, and above all else delight with this game. Easily my favorite 'Choice Of'.

I've played most of the CoG and HG games and being a true Sherlockian, this is wonderful storytelling and has good replay value. I won't drop any spoilers but there's a couple totally unexpected endings if you can force yourself to play without romancing Sherlock. Swoon. Totally worth it.
An actual finished product, unlike most of these stories. A great game with huge variety of choices and interesting sidestories.

An incredibly engaging world that was fun to interact with. The context behind the choices offered are by far some of the best in this genre (giving different -reasons- behind making what basically amounted to the same choice at times was ingenious and well executed). It provided a wealth of depth to the main character and I became quite emotionally invested as a result. I'd love to see more work by this author, a truly fantastic read.
I was hooked from the beginning, well fleshed out characters, great action, and an abundance of choices make it well worth the price! About to start my second play through. Very happy, well done :)
Well written story,  I loved it
Quite long and incredibly well-written. The romance was explored upon the perfect amount and the plot was thought out and entertaining. Definitely recommended.
A story that made me choose the the path I regretted and made me realise that in the end, while I could've done better, I could've done a lot worse. Worth many more hours of my time.
The storyline is interesting and the replay value is huge. Every single action has a reaction and how you decide (morally too) affects your game. Great game.
Why do I have to be gay to play as a woman? Really screws the game.
This is a great game--well written and engaging. There appear to be sufficient turning points that it'll be really replayable, too. I'm looking forward to seeing more like it in the future!
Poured a days worth of hours into this easily. A bit wordy, but the variation in the passages makes it all very worth it.
Really good story mine was unique and epic

This was written by someone who wrote some of my favorite early CoGs and their talent is seen here again. It's lengthy, you have many options and paths, and the characters are fun. It just stinks a little that you can't choose your gender. *Possible spoilers*  As someone who knows a little about Sherlock Holmes, the Finch twist was not at all surprising, but I found myself looking forward to it anyway.
Love it!
Great story and tough choices. Has an interesting setting and characters. Would love to see more stories that gives further insight of the world
You play as (pretty much) Watson in a Steampunk world in this retelling of Sherlock Holmes, freaking awesome

I agree with some of the other reviewer that it's too bad that you can't choose your character's gender. On the other hand, it accurately represents the mores of the (pseudo) Victorian era that way, and I can't fault historical accuracy. The possible story arcs are gripping, with challenging moral choices to be made at every turn (and complex motives). You're not 'just' a John Watson analogue (partner to a deductive genius), but you could've easily tread the path of Sebastian Moran, Jack the Ripper, Gertrude Bell (sort-of, certainly a worthy spymaster in this game of empires) or John Snow (no, not the Stark bastard, the Victorian epidemiologist who first mapped a cholera outbreak). It's a really fascinating work blending a fantasy world and fragments of actual history, kudos for the writers for that!

I loved this game. The setting was fantastic. I loved the nods to Sherlock (last name for my character was Watson). The characters were fleshed out. The romance believable. I loved all the choices and had to think hard about them. The emotion was good. I got numb from sadness at one part to happy at the next. My only qualm was no female option. That would have added a unique work tension. I loved that the choices branched out. The setting is amazing I wanna rp in it! I hope to see more in this world soon!

I really love everything else about this game, but I won't give a higher rating without a female option (seriously, it's a text-based adventure-a female option is not difficult).  I've seen reviews comment that the male-lock makes sense given the "backstory" of the game, but Choice of Broadsides didn't lock gender and had a similar "backstory" setting.

I've just finished my first playthrough of this story and thoroughly enjoyed. So much so that I immediately restarted it. It is a long title compared to most hosted games but that is definitely not a bad thing. At no point did the story drag or the choices feel unimportant. In fact some were so poignant and difficult to make that I actually found myself having dilemmas, which is rare for me. All in all this is a great title that I'm glad I tried.
Easily the best I've ever played. Immersing story, well-planned stoylines, and occasionally even heart-rendingly poignant. Would love for more content to be updated, or even a sequel.
Absolutely a brilliant game. Choices are plentiful and meaningful!
Long and we'll written
It's not so unreasonable to insert a highly unusual woman in a Steam punk setting. League of Extraordinary Gentlemen?
No bullshit, no crash on no connect, great story, great replay value. More by this author and his marketing team please.

What can I say. It is one of the best e-choice-novels that I have read. Offering so many choices in the story for you to choose from that comes with consequences & moral values. This is how a great story should be, to be able to churn up emotions & to be able to make you pay for those moral choices.  If you ever wanted a lot of time to spend on reading a great decent story book that you wish you can write the story, this is one of them.  10/10 will read it again.

Now I'm not into the whole steam punk idea as a while but this story grips you in and you feel like your singing the mysteries their. The romance is deep and makes you feel for it. The best is how the story has so many options that it's unlikely you will get the same ending over and over again like the others
Fantastic
More than meets the eye. It's exactly like a Sherlock Holmes book mixed with magic stuff and clockwork machines.

A brilliant and immersive story, with a rich and beautiful world. You feel almost immediately connected to your character, and I'll admit there were a couple of times this story got me right in the heart. I highly recommend this to anyone
Cool I like the use of imagination in the story. It is very worth being a COG games. The romances are really realistic. I like that there are a lot of different endings.
You definitely get your money's worth for it. It's a great story with a lot of replay value!
I know to recognise an epic when I see one. an emotional roller coaster, a good one at that. very minor spelling errors that do not affect gameplay in the slightest. 10/5
Very interactive, long storyline and a lot of choices. I enjoyed it very much.
This is easily one of the best games, the story flows well and the characters are great.
Story had me emotionally invested.
As a huge COG fan I can safely say this is among the best of them.

I was kinda hoping to be able to choose my char's gender, but I quickly got over it as I became immersed in the story. The writing is well done...  Great pacing, your choices really do matter and the romance is very satisfying. I'm only 2/3 of the way my 1st playthrough and you've got me hook, line and sinker!  If you like interactive fiction with a strong romantic component, this one is for you!! I've played Ms.  Albano's other games and I've always enjoyed them. But this one is truly a gem!

Well written, very enjoyable, plentiful options. I really enjoyed this story. That plot twist with my husband Garrett really got me. I must say, I was very angry at him (and very happy with the option to put him in place). I wanted to romance Chase after my husband dumped me for my choices and beliefs.. sad it wasn't an option. Otherwise, incredible story. Very much loved - however, the ending (though there are many) I got seemed quite abrupt. "WHAT?!" was my exact reaction. Will there be a part 2?

This was a very good story. When I heard Steampunk I wasn't sure what to think admin not too much of a fan, but this was really a great story. Great narrative with very believeable characters. It wasn't a power fantasy where you could do everything, but you DID make a difference. One of the most well written stories I've read in a LONG time. I thoroughly enjoyed it and hope to see more like it.
This is a great epic.
Awesome

Having the player character more set in backstory and unable to choose gender was a very minor disappointment compared to the depth of choices available, the nuances in them, and how enthralling the whole story was! Just finished my first run of it - /definitely/ calls for a replay. Very likely many.

Good story with good choices. My only issue is that, while you can choose your sexuality, you are male. It doesn't seem like it would have been that hard to allow that choice either. But the setting is creative, and the background is rather interesting.
Amazing depth one of the best on hosted games 😊

the universe was very well fleshed out. the romances felt believable. the decisions made had actual repercussions. all in all a game worthy of the CoG name. good job. now the bad thing is that you cant choose genders but thats probably because in this setting a female cant join the army as a required backstory. other than that, cool game
